availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: On Motion of John M Sherley leave is given him to keep a Tavern at his house in Greensburg for one from the date hereof and from thence until the next term of this Court he having made it appear to the Court that he is well prepared to Keep a tavern and paid the tax required by law and entered into bond with John Moore as his surity and had the proper oath administered to him The Clerk is ordered to issue license to him accordingly

A Copy attest
Robert Marshall Clk

State of Kentucky
Green County sct
I Robert Marshall clerk of the Green County Court Certify that I as clerk aforesaid issued John M Sherley Tavern License according to the foregoing order
Given under my hand this 1st day of March 1861
